ã€‚

cat

Once upon a time, I had a cat, I had ten dollars, I would buy it food for eight dollars, bathe it often, and it was very sticky to me.

Later, I took it out to play, passers-by thought it was cute, they fed it cat food, ham sausage, I was very unhappy because it was mine. I wanted to carry it home, but he broke away from me and meowed at the person who gave it good food, I hugged him a few times and he didn't go with me, and scratched me, so I turned around and left.....

Later, I came across it by chance on the road, and it was dirty. Passers-by will only give it good food and play with it, but they will not take it home and bathe it. It saw me and followed me home, I shut it out, it meowed outside the door, it was very uncomfortable,
but I wouldn't want it anymore
.

Blizzard ÑƒĞ²Ñ–Ğ¹ÑˆĞ»Ğ¸ Ğ´Ğ¾ Ñ‡Ğ°Ñ‚Ñƒ)
Ğ”Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ°Ğ¹Ñ‚Ğµ ÑƒĞºÑ€Ğ°Ñ—Ğ½ÑÑŒĞºÑƒ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ²Ñƒ Ñ‚Ğ° Ğ¾Ğ·Ğ²ÑƒÑ‡ĞºÑƒ.

This is the 6th season of the second entry of Overwatch, and Blizzard still manages to have server issues even after day one. it's 11:00 in the morning and I can't play the game, I can't even go into shooting range...

There are so many things I want to talk about, and I'm NOT going to spare any detail.

I've been playing OW since it first came out in 2016. Every single season, day one comes with massive server issues, long queue times or at the best of times very high ping lobbies. I suppose they think to themselves "this should blow over in a day or two, lets not rent another server to mitigate initial crowd, we'll visit the brothel with the money."

Gameplay is not changed in a significant way since the first entry. They reworked movement mechanics but apparently that rework didn't fix crouch and A-D spamming. You still have to aim for the median point of enemies head, and hope for the best.

The game is and always has been a MOBA, don't make a mistake. At first the gameplay feels like an arena shooter of the old (like Unreal or Quake) but when you get hard-countered by a hero ability, you'll soon realise this is just a rock-paper-scissors MOBA gameplay without the flexibility of having items or leveling up. The point of OW is to swap heroes on the go, to retaliate to counter-picks, but most of the time no one will want to swap heroes because they don't know how to play others. This causes in-fights within teams like almost every other match, one or more team mate gets titlted, and it's GG. None of these elements have changed since the first game either.

Teams are very reliant on healers, they're the WIPs of this game. If one of your healers die, you're all dead. If you kill one of their healers, they're all dead. If one of your healers is incompetent or inept, you're screwed. No matter how good everyone else in the team, if their healers are both good, you're fighting an up-hill battle. This is not the case for the other roles, at least not as much. A bad DPS gets to suck for the whole match and not die if the healers doing their jobs. If both teams have bad DPS but good healers, the game turns into a overly-detailed whack-a-mole simulator with invincible moles.

By the way, healers are called supports in this game, and some people say "they're not healers, they're supports". THERE IS NO SUCH THING AS A SUPPORT IN THIS GAME. If a healer is trying to do damage while their team mates have less then 90% health, they're throwing! The only condition where they can win is that enemy teams one or both healers have the same stupid idea, so the balances are checked out that way (sometimes).

They removed lootboxes, only to replace it with something far, FAR worse. OW lootboxes could be eanred free, opened without a key requirement. I got all my skins for free in OW1 thanks to them. That must have pissed of some of the share holders, because they completely changed that system. Now everything has a price, and the prices are outrageous. They utilize FOMO and strategic pricing to rip you off with your concent. 

'Oh you just earned 1000 OW coins with your purchase of a pack? Too bad, this new skin that we ripped off of the season pass at the last second is priced at 1100 OW coins. I guess you need to buy more OW coins, tee hee....'

The only two things that are good about this game are the art style and the underlying gameplay. It's fun to play with friends (which would be a compliment to your friends, not to OW). There is an infinite amount of NSFW content for the heroes, but that's not Blizzard's doing either.

So, f-*k this game, f#Â£k Blizzard and f=*k  Bobby Cotick. Play for free as much as you want, don't pay a single dime is my suggestion. Have a great day.

ä¸æ˜¯äººä»¬æŠ›å¼ƒäº†å®ˆæœ›å…ˆé”‹ã€‚è€Œæ˜¯å®ˆæœ›å…ˆé”‹ä¸ä¼šæ˜¯ç©å®¶çš„è‹±é›„äº†ã€‚å†ä¹Ÿä¸ä¼šæ˜¯äº†ã€‚It's not that people abandoned Overwatch. It's that Overwatch won't be the player's hero anymore. Not Anymore.

ã€Šå®ˆæœ›å…ˆé”‹ï¼šå½’è¥¿ã€‹
ä»€ä¹ˆå‚»é€¼æš´é›ª æˆ‘çœŸæ˜¯æ“ä½ å¦ˆäº† èƒ½ä¸ªè„‘æ®‹ä¸€æ · å‘ç°æ²¡æœ‰ä¸­å›½å¸‚åœºä½ å°±æ˜¯ä¸ªJB  åˆæ¥steamæ°çƒ‚é’±äº†æ˜¯å§

[h1]Overwatch 2 was a highly anticipated sequel, but unfortunately, it falls short in many aspects. The game fails to live up to its promises and instead continues the issues of its predecessor, without delivering satisfactory improvements and innovations.[/h1]

Firstly, the depth of the game's content is lacking. While there are some new maps and heroes introduced, overall, the content feels relatively sparse. This leads to players quickly experiencing repetitiveness, a lack of freshness, and a lack of long-term appeal. More maps, modes, and storylines would help enrich the gaming experience.

Secondly, balance issues persist in the game. Some heroes are overly powerful while others remain relatively weak, resulting in an unfair playing field. This leaves some players feeling frustrated and helpless. The developers need to pay more attention to balancing the game, ensuring that each hero has their own space to shine.

Furthermore, the progression system in the game has received criticism. The current system is shallow, lacking incentives and reward mechanisms. Players' efforts and sense of achievement are limited, lacking long-term motivation and goals. A more in-depth and meaningful progression system would provide players with the drive to continue engaging with the game.

At the same time, there are issues with community interaction and communication from the developers. There is a lack of effective communication between the developers and players, with a lack of proactive response to community feedback and concerns. This lack of communication and interaction leaves players feeling ignored and alienated, unable to truly participate in the game's development.

Additionally, concerns arise regarding server and network stability in the game. Players frequently encounter connectivity issues, delays, and disconnections, which disrupt the smoothness and overall experience of the game. Stable servers and reliable network infrastructure are basic requirements for an online game, and the developers need to enhance their technical support and maintenance in these areas.

[h1]Overall, Overwatch 2 represents Blizzard's lack of integrity. Have they forgotten what they have done? Do they still expect to sell it based on nostalgia? I will never play any Blizzard game again, and I hope everyone avoids playing any Blizzard game!!![/h1]

As someone who loved, and still loves this game. Do NOT waste your time with this. I started playing in 2017 and the game wasn't perfect by any means, but you could tell the people working on the game cared about what they were doing. That has since stopped with the release of Overwatch 2. Blizzard made empty promises of in depth PVE (which was the only reason they were re-branding to Overwatch 2) and cancelled the in-depth PVE after the game was already released for a cash grab version of what they told us we were getting. 

In conclusion, Overwatch 2 is just a cash grab game from the most predatory game company I know.
Created by the talented, ruined by the incompetent, just like things in real life.
